message: Steve's recent Security Now segment on creating a brute force resistant password is brilliant. Here's an idea I thought about on a methodology to create passwords based on it. Think of a word, let's say Leo's bad password "Monkey", add a 2 digit number like 46. So Monkey46 would sort of be the memorable hint. Then the actual password would be something like $$$$Monkey))))))46 - 4 Symbols padded in front, 6 Symbols padded behind. Then add the 46 for another hundred billion years of a unbrute forceable password. The only downside is forgetting the symbols you used for the padding. So, 1.28 hundred billion trillion centuries until the password is cracked. http://www.grc.com/haystack.htm
It's a terrific technique for memorable, secure passwords!
